Node.definition: = deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God
to store up events; hence: = to prepare for events to take place in the future
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
literally: to know (God); hence: = action by which humans, either as individuals or as groups, assume a position of subservience towards a deity
= process by which someone perceives an important object with the eyes, or witnesses an event of some significance

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it
= a large group of domesticated mammals that moves and stays together, either in an enclosure or in a open area ◄ usually sheep or goats, but can also include camels or cattle
= action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force

= causative action by which humans lead domestic animals to places where they can feed on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

= domestic animal belonging to the same family as the horse, but smaller and with longer ears; it can have variety of colors from dark brown, through light brown to gray and occasionally white; ◄ |iEquus Asinus africanus;|i* ► used to ride on, carry loads, or do other work; ≈ highly regarded; for male see עַיִר (עַיִר) female see אָתֹון (אָתֹון)

= person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor
= to seize an object as a pledge for a loan

= woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor
= causative action by which humans cause other humans to leave the main road to interrupt their journey or take a side road
= person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= action by which humans go to a location where they will not be readily seen by others; ► in order to be safe from danger or to attack someone else
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

= wild donkey of a relatively large size but with relatively small ears; it has a fawn color with a whitish chest and belly; ◄ Persian Wild Ass or Onager, Equus hemonius; ≈ associated with both untameable wildness and sexual desire
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= general term for food; ◄ from plants as well as meat; ≈ with no suggestion of aggression involved in obtaining it
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

= a piece of land outside of inhabited areas, which is the property of individuals, generally used for cultivating food trees, grain, and vegetables; can be bought and sold; property which can be transferred from one person to another
= mixture ◄ consisting of entire plants, including leaves, stalks, and grain; ► served as food for domestic animals
= field where grapes (עֲנָב) are cultivated, growing on vines (גֶּפֶן) typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a watchtower (מִגְדָּל) and a wine press (יֶקֶב)
= causative action by which humans bring together and take in objects from scattered places or sources
= state in which humans are either without clothes or insufficiently dressed; ≈ often associated with poverty or shame
= action when people or objects stay overnight in a certain place
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= generic designation for any article of clothing

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
literally: covering; hence: the clothing that are needed for protection against the cold and enable people to function within their community
= referring to a state of low temperature
= process by which copious amounts of water flow from the skies, often accompanied by strong winds and having a destructive effect
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= location where one goes to find protection or safety; ◄ because of difficult circumstances

Node.gloss: to embrace > to cling to|to huddle against
Node.definition: = action by which humans take position in the close vicinity of an object as if they were embracing it
= mass of rock projecting and forming an elevation
= action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force
= one of the breasts of a woman

= person whose father has passed away and therefore unable to care for himself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the widows, and other people who are poor
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility
= to seize an object as a pledge for a loan
= state in which humans are either without clothes or insufficiently dressed; ≈ often associated with poverty or shame
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move through an area without a specific destination
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= generic designation for any article of clothing
= condition of not having food to eat, often leading to weakness

Node.gloss: to take up|to lift up|to carry
Node.definition: literally: to lift up; hence: = action by which humans take hold of objects with their hands, with the intention of holding them or bringing them to another location
= bundle of harvested ears of grain
= the area separating two or mores locations
= row of plants in a field or orchard
= action by which humans press olives ► in order to produce olive oil

= a basin ◄ hewn out of a rock or lined with plaster ► into which harvested grapes were thrown and trampled to squeeze out the juice, which from there flowed into a trough or vat; ≈ treading a winepress is often used as a figure of speech to refer to God's anger and punishment

= action by which someone move their feet with force on a surface or object, usually in a repetitive way ► which causes an effect on the surface or object whereupon it happens; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= state in which someone senses a feeling of needing or wanting to drink, ► which eventually leads to weakness or even death; ≈ also used in a figurative sense to denote a longing or desire

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= human beings, regardless of sex and age
= action by which humans make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering
= the dead body of a human being, ◄ as defined by the life principle that used to animate it; ≈ contact with it causes ritual uncleanness
= state in which humans or animal are fatally wounded with a sharp object

Node.gloss: to cry out|to cry for help
Node.definition: = action by which humans and animals raise their voice ◄ in times of hardship ► hoping to receive help from God or someone else
= the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

Node.gloss: to place (responsibility on someone) > to lay upon|to bring upon|to impose upon|to charge with|to commit to
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities hold (other) humans responsible for an event that has taken place or that is to take place in the future

= action by which humans speak to a deity, often by raising their hands, ► requesting help or expressing their thankfulness|= state when a certain activity does not appear to be in accordance with good sense

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= process by which humans understand the identity or nature of (other) humans, objects or events

= an open space connecting different places, ► used for travelling and transportation; ≈ often extended to denote our life as a journey from birth to death, and the totality of our activities during our lives
= state in which humans remain in a place that is not their home for a relatively short time

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= person who takes the life of another human
= causative action by which humans or deities cause people to die
= a class of people who are suffering, often because of poverty but also because of an oppressive external situation; ≈ associated with humility
= person who does not have the means to provide for himself/herself, economically or otherwise, and therefore depends on help from other people and God
= the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship
= human who secretly takes possession of objects belonging to someone else, and sometimes even other humans, without permission or legal right and usually without intending to return it

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= action by which married humans have voluntary sexual intercourse with other humans who are not their spouse; ≈ often used as a metaphor for treachery or idolatry
= action by which humans or deities carefully observe an object or event for a longer period of time

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= process by which humans perceive, either with their physical eyes or in a vision

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
= state in which people, animals, or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

Node.gloss: to place|to put|to lay|to set|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause objects or (other) humans to be located in a certain place
= causative action by which humans make a hole in the ground or a wall, usually with the help of a digging tool; ► in order to be able to gain access to the location behind it

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= during the daytime
literally: to put a seal on oneself; hence: = action by which humans cause themselves not to be seen by others, ◄ as if made inaccessible by a seal
literally: to know; hence: = process by which humans know what a certain experience is about by studying or living through it

= light as a physical phenomenon, mainly observed during daytime, and the opposite of darkness; ◄ one of God's most important attributes; first created by God and since produced by sun, moon, and stars, but also by fire; ► enables people and animals to see; ≈ associated with life, goodness, happiness, prosperity, security, favor, and wisdom, loved by the righteous, and hated by the wicked
= state in which humans or objects are jointly involved in an event
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

literally: shadow of death, only found in poetry; hence: = state in which there is a total absence of light ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer to distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, fear, death, and oblivion
= process by which humans understand the identity or nature of (other) humans, objects or events
= something that instills an intense and overpowering fear in someone else; ≈ often associated with death and darkness

literally: shadow of death, only found in poetry; hence: = state in which there is a total absence of light ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer to distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, fear, death, and oblivion
= state in which humans, animals, and things have the ability to move or act with speed ◄ due to lack of weight, agility, strength, training, or energy
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

= actions by which humans or deities consign other humans or deities or inanimate objects to death, damage, or destruction, usually by invoking the name of a deity if the agent is human; ◄ this is done as punishment, out of contempt, fear, anger, or hostility, or because one was paid to do so; ► the effectiveness of a curse partially depends on the authority of the one pronouncing it
= object that is owned by someone; ◄ usually with the underlying assumption that it has been shared out to that person (or his ancestors) in the past

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
literally: road; hence: = a point to or from which a person or thing moves or faces, ◄ understood as the road between that person or thing and the point in focus
= field where grapes (עֲנָב) are cultivated, growing on vines (גֶּפֶן) typically surrounded by a stone wall, and equipped with a watchtower (מִגְדָּל) and a wine press (יֶקֶב)
= state in which there is a lack of water or rainfall, ► resulting in lack of vegetation and other desert like conditions

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= state in which the atmosphere has a relatively high temperature
= action by which humans take property unlawfully from a person or place, usually by force or threat of force

= frozen crystallized water vapor in the form of very white flakes which fall as precipitation from the sky and cover the ground during freezing cold weather; as soon as the temperature rises above freezing, it melts and becomes water; ≈ associated with cold, whiteness, or purity

= abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether or not on purpose, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution

= part of the lower body of women and mammals where offspring are conceived and in which they grow until their birth; ≈ sometimes extended to refer to a woman, the time of birth, the place where something is produced, and the innermost part of an area
= state in which food tastes well

= small, soft, legless, tube shaped creatures that have no bones or shells; they typically feed on overripe fruit, rotting meat, and similar things; most are larvae that hatch from the eggs laid by flies or some beetles; associated with uncleanness, mortality, decay, and death

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= any kind of tall, woody plant that grows from a single trunk and with several lateral branches that often bear leaves and fruit
= the state of being or acting in an unjust or morally evil way
= action by which humans have sexual relations with other humans
= state in which humans or animals, whether male or female, are unable to procreate
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety

= woman whose husband has died and therefore has difficulty caring for herself; ≈ regarded as one of the weaker members of the society and should therefore receive special care, together with the aliens, the fatherless, and other people who are poor
= action by which humans or deities act in a way that is morally and/or ethically right
= causative action by which humans or animals move an object from one location to another, usually with some effort or difficulty
= powerful person
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

Node.gloss: to have faith|to keep faith|to trust|to believe
Node.definition: = state in which humans are confident with regard to another person or deity, which means that this person or deity does only speak the truth but is also faithful, and willing and able to help

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= state in which humans live with confidence and without fear; ≈ often regarded as carelessness, especially when there is no mention of trust in YHWH

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= relatively low frequency of events or short duration of an event

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
literally: to sink in; hence: = process by which humans lose their prosperity and security
= process by which plants slowly dry up and die

= upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= particle linking two propositions, by which Y represents the purpose or result of X

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to prove someone to be a liar
Node.definition: = causative action by which human show or prove other humans to be telling a lie
= causative action by which humans or deities make objects or (other) humans different from what they were before
